Intro:

Women have come a long way in the gaming world since the 90s, as discussed in “Does Lara Croft Ware Fake Polygons”, Anne-Marie Schleiner discusses the gender roles and identity issues in the 1996 video game “Tomb Raider”. Working Thesis: In the turn of the century, a lot has happened for women in the world, especially in media. Thus creating a revolution for many other communities such as for people of color, the LGBTQ+ community, and even men. Although there have been advancements in iIdeology and equality, there are many setbacks as well. The solution for the setbacks may not be easy to pursue, but as a human race, we have plenty of time to learn and to trust the process.

 

Body 1

In “Does Lara Croft Ware Fake Polygons”, Schleiner discusses the gender roles and identity issues in the 1996 video game “Tomb Raider”. The iIntroduction of Lara Croft has changed the gaming world in regards to gender empowerment. She argues that prior to Tomb Raider, video games mainly used a male protagonist,and Lara Croft’s introduction has revolutionized that idea. The author explores the idea that the female protagonist from the popular franchise embodies a multitude of ideas such as: a techno-puppet to the male-gaze, a drag queen, a dominatrix, and a powerful feminist role model. Artistic and creative game patches provide an “opportunity for feminists to influence the formation of new computer game gender configurations”.



  1. Body II
  1. Introduce main point with advancements we made
  2. Compare and contrast new Lara Croft
  3. Discuss women portrayal in other games
  4. Introduce how women portrayal have changed in other media such as tv shows, Movies, and IRL.
  5. Discuss strong women that have made an impact



  1. Body III
  1. Talk about how Lara Croft effected LGBT community
  2. How the LGBT has had more spotlight

 

  1. Body IV
  1. How women are still Portrayed bad
  2. Double Standards
  3.  How the is show in all Media
  4. Why it isnt good for everyone

 

 

  1. Body V
  1. Drawbacks for LGBT
  2. How it sheds Bad light
  3. Transition where do we go from here

 

Today a lot of media are creating characters to shed light to the diversity we have today, but those same company are also rehashing old character or shedding the light poorly with stereotypes or taking old character and changing their background rather than creating original characters or referencing true events.

 

  1. Body VI
  1. Talk about how we can Improve
  2. Bring up points from Body I - IV
  3. Share Points on What to do and how it can better Media and IRL

 

  1. Conclusion
  1. Summary
  2. Reiteration of certain points
  3. Wrap up and raise important question
